meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a peg.
meanings.sent1: She pegged the drawing on the wall.
meanings.sent2: He always pegs his tent securely to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel pegged the acorn to the tree for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The idea of friendship was pegged firmly in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her first bike ride was pegged in her heart forever.

meanings.definition: To mark or indicate with a peg.
meanings.sent1: He pegged the location of the buried treasure on the map.
meanings.sent2: The hiker pegged the trail with colorful markers.
meanings.sent3: The chef pegged the secret ingredient in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The detective pegged the suspect's alibi as false.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pegged the correct answer on the board for all to see.

meanings.definition: To fix or establish at a specific level or rate.
meanings.sent1: They pegged the interest rate for the loan.
meanings.sent2: The company pegs the price of their products each year.
meanings.sent3: The weatherman pegged the temperature at a scorching level.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was pegged at an all-time high.
meanings.sent5: The athlete pegged his performance to perfection during the championship.
